instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3536: What is 820-3536? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: mbp retina 2013 ram upgrade
threads.message: One of my friends has the first mbp 13" with only 4gb of ram (I didn't believe they even made it until i looked it up). Does anyone know what and where i could get ram chips and stencil for 16gb? also how hard is it to do?

threads.title: mbp retina 2013 ram upgrade
threads.message: Nope, not worth the trouble (and that's assuming you could even get it to work properly--probably not). Just tell your friend to sell his board and buy the one he wants.

threads.title: mbp retina 2013 ram upgrade
threads.message: NO NO NO NO NEVER! Also 4GB and 8GB boards are different. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> vs. <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3536</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. Just no!

threads.title: mbp retina 2013 ram upgrade
threads.message:
also if you would check rewa tech on youtube they just made a movie about ram replacement.
also need to do bios, and something more cant remember from my mind....

good luck on this,

also chips cant be swaped.  they are Always paired
so 1 set +bios same board...

good luck.
